snippet: The Wednesday attack dealt a grave blow to the leadership of the Syrian government’s war machine and struck an even bigger psychological one to its ability to project a sense of power.
abstract: Bombing attack in Damascus deals grave blow to the leadership of the Syrian government’s war machine and strikes an even bigger psychological one to its ability to project a sense of power; Asef Shawkat, a brother-in-law to President Bashar al-Assad and a top enforcer in his embattled government, is among the ministers killed; in a government that always entrusts top security posts to close relatives, the death of Shawkat is the most critical loss.

byline.original: By DAVID D. KIRKPATRICK and KAREEM FAHIM
byline.contributor: David D. Kirkpatrick reported from New York, and Kareem Fahim from Cairo.

lead_paragraph: The Wednesday attack dealt a grave blow to the leadership of the Syrian government’s war machine and struck an even bigger psychological one to its ability to project a sense of power.

headline.seo: Valued Relative and 2 Strong Loyalists Die in Damascus Attack
headline.main: Blast Strips Assad of a Valuable Family Member and a Pair of Powerful Loyalists
headline.print_headline: Blast Strips Assad of a Valuable Family Member and a Pair of Powerful Loyalists
